channel.title: Mars on Astronomy posts by a computer geek
channel.description: Recent content in Mars on Astronomy posts by a computer geek

item.title: Where Earth life originated?
item.description: Where Earth life originated? First of all happy new year and wish all have a good year ahead. It was during my holiday that I started to think where possibly Earth life originated. Was it there since the beginning of time? Or aliens introduced it? Or a meteorite hit the Earth at some point and brought some microbes survived all the way? For that, I did some search on the net, as usual, and found an interesting article from Space.

item.title: Phobos and Deimos, Mars moons
item.description: Introduction Recently, I have stumbled upon an article about Mars moons. To be honest, I didn’t know that Mars has any moons at all until I read the article. Anyhow, after reading the article, I decided to write a short blog post to introduce Mars moons for those, like me, who don’t know about them. Mars moons Mars has two moons named Phobos and Deimos. Phobos is the bigger one and Deimos is the smaller.
